Topic.Title: Where can you find a game's text on the Quest application?

Posts.EditableText:
I was given a fully written, but still very buggy game by a friend while I was in a high school writing class. My problem is that I can't complete the game due to bugs, but I want to read the full story now (this is several years later). I looked through the game on the HTML developer tools but couldn't find where the text was stored, and I was hoping that someone on this forum would be able to help me out. 
Thank you for your time.
Posts.HTML:
I was given a fully written, but still very buggy game by a friend while I was in a high school writing class. My problem is that I can't complete the game due to bugs, but I want to read the full story now (this is several years later). I looked through the game on the HTML developer tools but couldn't find where the text was stored, and I was hoping that someone on this forum would be able to help me out.
Thank you for your time.

Posts.EditableText: If this is a ".quest file", you can unzip it to reveal the individual files.  Then use a text editor (Notepad ++ is free and recommended) to open up the main game file/library files.
Posts.HTML: If this is a ".quest file", you can unzip it to reveal the individual files. Then use a text editor (Notepad ++ is free and recommended) to open up the main game file/library files.

Posts.EditableText: You need to download the quest program yourself. Open the game with it, and on the first tab/ button, click "open for editing."
Posts.HTML: You need to download the quest program yourself. Open the game with it, and on the first tab/ button, click "open for editing."
